dialogues.text: No thanks. Not until I get a few people I know to come with mei we Challis starts back toward his room.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Have it your own way, Mister Smith. And it looks as though you will.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) And the name is Challis. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Oh. I quite liked Smith. What a pity... Cocran walks back to the Cadillac and gets in. The Graysuits and Technicians move to their cars. Rafferty slips away. The cars begin to pull out. ‘Two cars lag behind. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis steps in. Ellie is gone. The room is empty. The suitcase is still on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Ellie? Silence. Challis moves to the bathroom and peers inside. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Ellie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can just make out Ellie in one of the cars that glides back into the factory. She is jammed in the .back with two factory men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis rushes out of the door. And stops.

dialogues.speaker: GRAYSUITS
dialogues.text: Lined up outside the room. SIX GRAYSUITS. Gaunt, Irish faces. Staring at Challis. One Graysuit, (THE ASSASSIN, we'll call him) stands forward of the other men. He is towering, granite- faced. His eyes are cold, steel gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis backs inside. Quickly shuts the door. Locks it. Then he turns and races into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis slams the door behind him. And moves for the small window above the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door BLASTS IN off its hinges. The Graysuits rush into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis squeezes out of the small bathroom window and plops down to the ground. He gets up immediately and begins to run. CAMERA GLIDES WITH HIM. Along the dark, muddy alley behind the motel. Around the back of the gas station. Challis races along. 166 CHALLIS .POV:-. MOVING SHOT +.STREET: 9 (+ 8 0°0 166: Factory cars zip along the street toward the motel.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS, (PANAGLIDE)
dialogues.text: Down another alley. Running with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA HURTLES ALONG.
dialogues.text: Ahead, at the end of the alley, several factory cars pull up, blocking off Challis' escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis dashes out of the alley and runs along the main street. CAMERA FRANTICALLY CAREENS ALONG WITH HIM.

dialogues.speaker: REMOTE TV CAMERA
dialogues.text: The TV camera moves slowly on a servo, following Challis.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: The infra-red image from the TV camera: Challis runs down the street into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie is being led along by several factory men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Factory cars BLAST around the corner. Searching for Challis.

dialogues.speaker: STORES
dialogues.text: Several SANTA MIRA RESIDENTS stand in front of. their stores. Watching the cars ROAR by. Staring after them. Emotionless. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda Challis is fast asleep. The phone RINGS on the table beside her. She starts confusedly in the double-bed she now occupies alone.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes...? Who the...John! {sitting up) What do you want? Is this some kind of--? She listens with increasing amazement.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're drunk! I know you, John! You've been drinking all night and you... She listens again. Frowning. Shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (continuing) The Halloween masks? The ones I bought? You want me to--what? Linda explodes.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: (continuing) Mommie gives them the masks, and Daddy tries tb take them away. It's just the same old crap! You're jealous because you know the children love me more than they love you-- You just go to hell! . She SLAMS the phone down. Then, so as not to be disturbed again, she takes it off the hook. She looks up. Willie, wearing his SKULL mask as well as his pajamas, has come into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIE
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: Nobody, sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis frantically dials again. A busy signal. He hangs up, reaches in his pocket for more change, plunks it in and dials another number. Car headlights flash across the phone booth. Challis turns.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Two factory cars move ominously up the road.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Challis quickly ducks out of the phone booth and runs into the darkness of the houses along the road. The factory cars SCREECH to a stop at the phone booth. Factory men get out. Stare up the street.

dialogues.speaker: ROAD
dialogues.text: Challis is gone into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The factory looms in the b.g. IN CLOSE F.G. is another remote TV camera. It pans slowly around, searching the night with its blank, infra-red eye. WE “BOOM ‘DOWN'"TO REVEAL CHALLIS hiding directly underneath the TV camera, out of sight of the lens. As the TV camera pans away from him, Challis runs quickly into the shadows of the factory wall. The infra-red eye has not seen him.

dialogues.speaker: FACTORY WALL
dialogues.text: Challis' face emerges from the shadows for a moment. In the b.g. more factory cars race around the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis hoists himself over the chain-link fence. He drops into shadow just as a factory car streaks past. He hurries along the factory wall. DOLLY with him, past rows and rows of high windows, past heavily bolted doors. Up ahead, SEE one of the windows. Open. Just a crack. Challis tiptoes to it, climbs up and slithers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis slips from the shadows and along the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis peeks from a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “) The mask-works. As before. Maskworkers working - silently.

dialogues.speaker: 182B BACK TO CHALLIS .- 182B
dialogues.text: He fades back into the shadows..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis-enters. stealthily. Light from the display ' cases. throws eery shadows.:on.the :wall as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high angle looking down. Challis enters silently, surveys the empty room, goes back the way he came. PAN OVER to a remote TV camera stationed nearby, pointed downward, toward Challis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “HALLOWEEN 3"

dialogues.speaker: REV. 4/4/82
dialogues.text: Now Challis turns to the door marked "PRIVATE" -- the one tried by Ellie earlier. He opens it a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cochran looks around. The room is a spacious office, with a huge desk and chair. Beyond this is a large workbench, with tools and equipment of all kinds. We are looking at the workbench of an inventor. Toys, model trains, mechanical parts, masks, musical instru- ments lie about. Dark and spooky; eccentric. Challis moves through the place carefully, toward a pool of light around the corner TO SEE: Another desk. An antique desk lamp. Seated at the desk is an OLD WOMAN. Huddled over a game of solitaire. Her gloved hands flip the cards method- ically.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS AND OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Challis moves up behind the cold woman.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Where's the girl? The old woman ignores him. Flips the cards.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where is she? In a burst of anger Challis g;: abs at her to pull her:around, ‘make ‘her listen.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her arm comes off in his hand!

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: The silk of her blouse tears. The whole shoulder joint is exposed. TICKS inside! A clockwork joint CLICKS and 69a.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS AND OLD WOMAN 187
dialogues.text: Challis stares in horror at-the arm he is holding. The fingers are still moving, still trying to flip cards that aren't there! Now the whole body of the old woman tips sideways. It sways toward him. He grabs it. The other hand is still holding the deck of cards. She slips from her chair. Challis struggles to get her back into it. Now her head droops at an angle no head should be at. Then the old woman slides to the floor. Her head comes right off! And now, with a CLICK, the mechanism ceases to function. The old woman is completely still. Challis stares in amazement. WHAM! TWO HANDS grab him from behind and whirl him around! The cold, emotionless face of the factory assassin stares into his! Challis SLAMS a fist into the assassin's midsection. Absolutely no reaction. As if the assassin hasn't felt it. Then suddenly Challis is hurled across the room. He SMASHES into a bookshelf and flops to the floor. The factory assassin moves for him. Challis springs from the floor and tackles the assassin. They go careening around the room,. CRASHING into: every- . thing; then finally sprawling tothe floor. : WHACK! The assassin's hand SNAPS on Challis' face! Fingers spread! Pressing into Challis' eyes! Challis grabs the hand viced on his face. But can't pull it off! The fingers close tighter! Challis raises his hand and plunges it downward!  188 189 190 191

dialogues.speaker: ASSASSIN'S STOMACH 188
dialogues.text: Into the assassin's stomach! And Challis' hand actually goes in! Through the shirt into the flesh! Milky silicone sprays out of the stomach! Challis rips his hand out. In his fist is a mass of micro- electronics, wires, chips, all covered with the milky silicone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis pulls himself out of the assassin's grip. He rolls away across the floor. The assassin remains motionless. Silicone pouring out of his mouth. His arm still in the air. The fingers still pressing inward. CLOSE ON CHALLIS oS 190 Out of breath. Stares. For a beat. Then suddenly HANDS GRAB HIM! FACTORY GUARDS pour into the office, pile on top of him, hold him down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cochran steps into the office. He looks like a host hurt by the unforgivable behavior of a guest. He glances at the immobile assassin, then picks up the old woman's head.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Clumsy. This was a rare piece. German. Made in Munich, 1685. I must try to get a replacement. My European agent...perhaps... (it is real regret, something short of grief. Now he comes to himself again) Mister Challis...It's been such a long night for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cochran goes to his desk, sets down the head and picks up a black, ornamented box. Gets himself a cigar. He strokes the lid of the box.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bog oak. From the bogs of Ireland. Do you smoke?

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (ignoring this) Where's Ellie?

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Mrs.--'Smith'? Why, I believe she's resting just. now. Challis moves as if to get up. A Graysuit hand slams him back into place.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: {continuing; looking at his watch) It didn't take you very long to get here, Mister Challis. It will be morning soon. Halloween morning. It's going to.be a busy day for me. And for you too. You'll recall I promised to show you everything. I always keep my promises sir, indeed I do... Cochran smiles his warm, fatherly smile. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is coming up. The factory yard looks blue and cold in the morning glow. All work has stopped in the yard. It looks deserted.

dialogues.speaker: LOADING DOCK 193
dialogues.text: Challis is escorted outside by two Graysuits, their hands clamped firmly on his arms. Cochran follows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “HALLOWEEN 3" REV. 4/4/82 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They cross the platform to the door marked NO ADMITTANCE. Cochran takes a key from his pocket and unlocks the door. They go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old and rickety, like the exterior of the factory. Cochran leads his troupe inside. WE FOLLOW, through a dark hallway and across an anteroom. Along the walls, standing stiffly, are the Yardmen. Frozen. Immobile. Robots.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: T'would be nice to work them around the clock. But the night air is bad for them... Cochran reaches the top of a long flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) Machines, Mister Challis. Every one. Except for you and me, of course. Challis glances at the two Graysuits holding his arms. No reaction from them. Blank. Emotionless.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) But you figured that out last night, didn't you? He moves down the steps. The Graysuits lead Challis along. behind ‘him. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jarring change. Polished metal, modern lighting. Cochran leads the others inside. The doors slide shut. One of the Darksuits pushes a button.

dialogues.speaker: DARKSUIT
dialogues.text: Going down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cochran smiles at Challis, amused.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Convincing, aren't. they? Loyal and obedient. One of the Darksuits holds out a pile of white garments to Cochran. He seats himself and puts them on over his shoes and hands. The other Darksuit wrenches a similar set onto Challis' hands and feet. They are the sort of thing found in dust-free laboratories, or germ-free clinics.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) The surprising thing is that the internal components are quite simple to produce, really. The external features took a lot longer to perfect, but in the end, it's just another form of maskmaking, The elevator lurches to a halt. The lighting goes red. A blower from somewhere sends air wafting through.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Ellie's father. You sent one of these out to kill him. Cochran smiles resignedly.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (continuing) Then it destroyed itself. No -evidence .to..lead. anyone back here to’ Santa Mira...

dialogues.speaker: _ COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Very good, Mister Challis. He was a very inquisitive man. Downright-- nosy, you might say. Cochran laughs at his own joke.

dialogues.speaker: GRAYSUIT
dialogues.text: Dust free area. No smoking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED, (2)
dialogues.text: A hiss, and the doors slide open. Darkness. Challis is pushed into the hands of two more Graysuits. Cochran follows him out. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment all is dark. Then someone moves. SEE lights down below. Cochran, dimly outlined, moves to a railing. WE FOLLOW.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Do you know anything about Halloween, Mister Challis? A remarkable scene reveals itself. Spread beneath us is a huge room, mostly in darkness. Directly below, surrounded by high-intensity lights, is a long rectangular stone, partially covered with protective material. Technicians are gathered around it. At the other end of the room is a tightly-gathered array of monitor screens and: consoles. (THE HIGH TECH AREA). Several more Technicians are busy here.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing; almost in a whisper) It was the start of the year in our old Celtic lands. We would wait in our houses made of turf. The barriers were down, you see, between the real and the unreal. ~The’ dead’ might. look: in; to.sit by our bit of’ fire. Hallowéen. The last great one was three thousand years ago. (as if remembering) The hills ran with the blood of countless sacrifices...

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Sacrifice... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: One had to be ready. It was part of our craft.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: +..witcheraft.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: You would call it that. To us it was a way of controlling our world. The only way. (the smile) I'm talking, of course, about my ancestors... Cochran moves along the catwalk. The others follow.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) They never dreamed of this. The harnessing and storing of power. Even their alchemy couldn't do this.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Do what, Cochran? What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: I'm surprised at you. You were doing so well. But there we.are.,..advanced technology is always magic to one who doesn't understand it. Anda great. magician never reveals his secrets. (a chuckle) Come along, Mister Challis. There's still time for you to figure it out... Cochran goes down a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR AREA 197
dialogues.text: They reach the.floor and-start across, passing. close to the stone, the Technicians, the lights, the video cameras.

Technicians. The rock. Tools, chipping away at it. Every chip being swept carefully into containers. A conveyer belt. Parther along, a small assembly line. The Silver Shamrock trade seals. Hands assembling them. Delicate, microscopic work. Tweezers, calipers; containers of the stone chips. The masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cochran, Challis and the Graysuits cross the floor.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (gesturing at the : stone) From an ancient shrine. I imagine even you have heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Stonehenge...

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Devil of a time getting it here. But, it had to be done. He turns to a stack of nearby cases, standing at the end of a long conveyer belt.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) It has a power in it, you see. A force. Even the tiniest particle of. it... . He reaches into one of the cases and pulls out a handful of the Silver Shamrock trade seals.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (continuing) ..-.can be devastating. He tosses the trade seals back into the box and picks up a skull mask nearby. He checks it, makes sure its trade-seal is on securely. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cochran moves on toward the high tech area.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH TECH AREA
dialogues.text: Cochran comes in. Challis and the Graysuits follow. Cochran moves over to a bank of video screens. Some feature details of the stonehenge rock; some feature corridors and anterooms; some are blank.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: You asked about the girl... He leans over and punches a button on a console. One of the blank screens rolls and flickers.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Elli lies on a stainless-steel tavle somewhere in a windowless room. A DARKSUIT stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Challis leans down close to the screen, staring at Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Where is she...?

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (pointing at the screen) Why, she's right in there, Mister Challis. (chuckling) By the way...your friend Miss Guttman didn't make it. Sorry. He punches another button. Another monitor flickers.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: A scanning shot, panning back and forth over Marge's body, covered by a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE 206
dialogues.text: Challis leans in.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: You killed her. Just like you plan to kill every child in the--

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: On no, Mister Challis! You're ' mistaken! Not 'just like' that at all. Miss Guttman was the victim of a misfire. The others... (glancing at his watch) But talk is cheap, isn't it? What you really want to see is a demonstration. (smiling) What good timing we're blessed with! There's one coming right Up... He turns to another console, hits another button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, Betty and Li'l Buddy walk through the factory yard. Led along by several GRAYSUITS.- Buddy clutches his traveling bag.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: I can't believe there are more i prizes. i BUDDY . Well,.he wants: my. advice.-on..some- ‘thing.’ “But“I° gotta talk to the’ guy. His organization is really screwing me up.

dialogues.speaker: LI'L BUDDY
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. When are we gonna have breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: In alittle while, honey... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LI'L BUDDY
dialogues.text: I have to go to the bathroom. Another GUARD lets them into the "STRICTLY NO ADMITTANCE" door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very plain, small room with three TV sets placed around. In the ceiling is another remote TV camera. Buddy, Betty and Li'l Buddy walk into the room. The door closes behind them. Buddy is glowering. Li'l Buddy clutches his JACK-O-LANTERN mask.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: (pulls papers from his traveling bag) Know what these are? My orders for next year--but they won't take 'em!

dialogues.speaker: LI'L BUDDY
dialogues.text: Daddiee...

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: You know the way I work. A long way ahead. Not just next week, but next year!

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay--can't we just pick up this prize and go home?

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: You've got to plan! I tell them, you're squandering your money, all this last-minute stuff .on Tv, just -planit! But nol. "No; Mr. Kupfer, we do it our way!"

dialogues.speaker: LI'L BUDDY
dialogues.text: I'm bored... Li'l Buddy tries turning on one of the TV sets. It doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: (ignores Li'l Buddy) Anybody would think this is the last Halloween ever! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Buddy, I wanna go home!

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: They're holding out on us! They got brand-new masks all stashed away and they won't let us see a one of 'em! I find that insulting! I truly resent it! You know what I got a mind to do--? Suddenly the three TV sets in the room blink on simultaneously. Li'l Buddy is startled. For a minute the screens are blank with static. Then the final Halloween commercial appears. Dancing JACK-O-LANTERNS. Children's faces.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: (V.0O.; Irish brogue) Time! It's time! All those lucky kids with Silver Shamrock masks, move close to your TV screen!

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: What's this? Li'l Buddy immediately responds to the announcer. He quickly pulls on his mask and moves up close to one of the TV screens. CAMERA PANS UP to the TV camera in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis is watching a TV screen: Buddy, Betty and Li'l Buddy stare at the commercial on the TV sets. A growing terror comes over Challis. Cochran also watches a monitor. A slow smile moves across his features. All the sounds from the small room come over a speaker. A TECHNICIAN operates the controls on a panel. Challis glances at the various buttons the technician is pushing, then looks back at the screen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: (v.0.) Is this the famous prize they're going to give you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No--they wouldn't do... Maybe they want us to give our opinions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy and Betty watch one of the TV sets. Li'l Buddy is riveted about four inches from his screen.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: What opinions?

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Whether or not we like the final commercial.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: You said you thought it was a waste of time--

dialogues.speaker: LI'L BUDDY 211
dialogues.text: JACK-O-LANTERN masked face up to the screen. The commercial rolling. Suddenly the TV screen flashes! A small brilliant light glows! Then the screen goes black. ‘And ‘theh’ the “glow again, “flashing on and‘ off like a strobe light! Li'l Buddy slowly raises his hands to the mask.

dialogues.speaker: ON BUDDY AND BETTY 212
dialogues.text: The glowing, flashing light flickers on their faces. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gl. aN 212 CONTINUED: 212

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Now what is this? They screwed up the commercial.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: I think that this whole thing is just a big joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy and Betty stand across the room by a TV. Suddenly Li'l Buddy lurches back into frame. Staggering, swaying back on his heels. His hands clutching the JACK-O-LANTERN mask. He pitches forward on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis. Staring at the scene in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “ Buddy continues to watch the flickering TV screen. Betty turns around.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY
dialogues.text: Li'l Buddy... And then she opens her mouth. . Not quite a scream. | A sort of speechless shock.

dialogues.speaker: ON LI'L BUDDY 216
dialogues.text: ! : ‘Li'l Buddy .raises-up.. His hands up to the mask whi is now melting away from his face! -His eyes are two blood-red orbs! The skin around them red, blistered and bursting! Then Li'l Buddy pitches forward again!

dialogues.speaker: LI'L BUDDY ON FLOOR 217
dialogues.text: Now Li'l Buddy lies on the floor. Body twitching. And then, out of the mouth of the mask, a small, $ furry appendage. And then another. Until a spider slowly crawls out!  218 219 220 221 222 223 224 225 82.

dialogues.speaker: ON BUDDY AND BETTY 218
dialogues.text: She SCREAMS! Buddy turns and sees his son.

dialogues.speaker: ON LI'L BUDDY 219
dialogues.text: Something else emerges from the expelling mouth: a_long black snake! It glides evilly across the blood; loor!

dialogues.speaker: BETTY . 220
dialogues.text: Betty moves toward her son. Something small and black and wriggling leaps on her face!

dialogues.speaker: BETTY 221
dialogues.text: The spider hugs her face! She SHRIEKS in horror, and lurches backward! The eight-legged thing stings her, again and again!

dialogues.speaker: ON BUDDY . 222
dialogues.text: He doesn't know what to do first. Gripped in a paralyzing fear. He moves toward his son.

dialogues.speaker: ON LI'L BUDDY 223
dialogues.text: Out of the mouth comes a lizard!

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY AND BETTY 224
dialogues.text: Buddy moves then for his wife. Betty crumples to the floor... The spider covers her face like a clutching hand! . Suddenly Buddy screams! And looks down!

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY'S LEG 225
dialogues.text: The snake has bitten into Buddy's leg! It holds on, its teeth sunk way into his flesh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis can barely look at the screen. Buddy's SCREAMS come over the speaker. Cochran turns from his screen.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: A plague is on them, Mr. Challis. Think of that in fifty million homes! All those little children in their masks in front of their TV sets. Buddy's SCREAMS suddenly stop. Silence from the speakers. Challis looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Buddy, Betty and Li'l Buddy lie on the floor. Motionless. Dead. The TV sets continue to flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis turns to Cochran.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: It's time again. The planets are in sisogy. It's Samhain. I'm going to change the world tonight. Forever. And you get to share in it.

dialogues.speaker: ON. CHALLIS . 229
dialogues.text: Just Staring at Cochran. ‘The factory guards close in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet, suburban, tree-lined residential street. CHILDREN dressed in Halloween costumes and Silver Shamrock masks, carrying bags of candy, walk along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING SHOT down a row of Silver Shamrock masks. CHILDREN stand behind a counter YELLING and GIGGLING and SCREAMING. CLERKS pull masks off the rack. CAMERA MOVES TO a Silver Shamrock display: a gyrating skull head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Halloween tonight, kids! Get your Silver Shamrock mask now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another residential street. More CHILDREN in Silver Shamrock masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Silver Shamrock commercial.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: (V.0.; Irish brogue) It's Halloween tonight, kids! Get your Silver Shamrock masks and watch the big Halloween Horrorthon!  234 235 236 237 238 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skyline of downtown Los Angeles. In f.g. CHILDREN in Halloween costumes move by.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER SHAMROCK MASKS 235
dialogues.text: The WITCH, JACK-O-LANTERN and SKULL masks are being cleaned off a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More CHILDREN. Silver Shamrock masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is going down. CHILDREN in costumes. Bags of candy. Silver Shamrock masks. A large delivery truck moves by. The Silver Shamrock logo emblazoned onthe side. A loudspeaker on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Halloween tonight, kids! Watch the Horrorthon with your Silver Sham- rock masks! And be by your television at nine o'clock! “SUPERIMPOSE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEGIN on a TV camera in the ceiling. MOVE DOWN to a clock on the wall. It reads: 7:45. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then PULL BACK to reveal a small, concrete-walled room. Challis is securely tied in a chair. In front of him is a TV set. He stares numbly at the screen. "Halloween" is being shown. Cochran stands behind Challis. Holding a SKULL mask. He slips it over Challis' head. Makes sure the mask is secure.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Happy Halloween, Mr. Challis. Cochran walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS 239
dialogues.text: Behind the SKULL mask, Challis' eyes. They glance to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another concrete room. TV camera in ceiling. Ellie is tied to a chair. In front of her is a TV set.

dialogues.speaker: TV SET 242
dialogues.text: The: movie "Halloween " Laurie Strode walks across ° a dark street. Spooky music.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE 243
dialogues.text: A WITCH mask is pulled over Ellie's head.

dialogues.speaker: TV 244
dialogues.text: "Halloween." Laurie Strode walks up to the Wallace house.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS . 245
dialogues.text: Struggling in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS 246
dialogues.text: Through the SKULL mask eye-holes. Challis' eyes. Dart around.
WE PAN UP to the remote TV camera in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a TV screen: we see Challis in the small room from ceiling level.

dialogues.speaker: ON TECHNICIAN 249
dialogues.text: He watches the screen. Cochran walks up. Glances at the screen. Then walks away. The TECHNICIAN turns away to another console for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis stares at the remote TV camera for several beats. Then at the Tv in front of him. The theme from "Halloween" tinkles away mindlessly. In a rage Challis lunges forward with the chair. His feet hit the base of the TV, toppling it.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV 251
dialogues.text: The TV set hits the floor! The screen IMPLODES with a DULL CRACK! The glass on the front of the screen is shattered in large shards!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Stares at the shattered TV. Then at the remote camera in the ceiling. Then Challis tips himself over. The chair SLAMS down on the floor, a few feet away from the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technician has completely turned his attention to the console next to him. He doesn't see the image on his TV screen: Challis, still tied to the chair, sliding across the floor to the broken set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis inches the chair up to the front of the TV set. He maneuvers himself so that his tied hands are inches from the shards.

dialogues.speaker: TV SET
dialogues.text: Challis' hands inch up to the broken shards. Finally he slips the ropes around one large piece of glass. And begins rubbing the ropes furiously on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS
dialogues.text: He rubs and tugs and pulls. Finally the ropes break! _His hands-are free! Challis rips off the SKULL mask. Looks up at the remote TV camera. Takes careful aim. And lobs the SKULL mask like a frisbee.

dialogues.speaker: ON REMOTE TV CAMERA
dialogues.text: The SKULL mask lands right on the lens of the remote camera! 88. 252 253 254 255 256 257

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technician finally turns back to his TV screen. It _is completely blank.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: I have a malfunction on camera 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis has grabbed a shard from the TV set. He saws away on the ropes still binding his feet. Finally he rips them off. Scrambles to his feet. Quickly moves to the door. Tries it. Locked. Challis looks around the room. His eyes stop.

dialogues.speaker: VENTILATOR PANEL 260
dialogues.text: A ventilator panel in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 261
dialogues.text: He grabs the chair and rushes to the wall under the ventilator panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cochran is seated at a desk. He is on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: _ (into phone) There. were a few we didn't manage to.sell. . The odd fifty thousand. Not many. ‘But the reports from our dealers are phenomenal. We've sold close to 150 million masks. The technician comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Cochran... Cochran waves him away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, phenomenal. And I just got a phone call from the network. They're projecting a 43 share for the Horrorthon. (pause) Yes, yes, I'm delighted. (pause) That's right. Nine o'clock. I wouldn't miss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis yanks the ventilator panel out of the wall. He lets it fall to the floor. In front of him is a large rectangular hole. Behind it the aluminum heating duct. Challis pulls himself up into the hole. CAMERA MOVES TO the clock on the wall. 8:11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis crawls along through the heating duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rounds a corner. A ventilator panel. Challis crawls up to it and peers out. CHALLIS’ POV - THRU VENTILATOR PANEL - HIGH-TECH AREA 266 Technicians at their consoles. Cochran seated at a desk talking on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis quickly crawls away.  gl. oy 268 INT. HIGH-TECH AREA 268

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, yes, I will. Thank you again. Cochran hangs up. The technician finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Cochran...

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: There's a problem with camera 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis comes to a junction in the duct. Two ways to go. Above him is a small access panel. He quickly opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oo Challis emerges on the roof of the factory. He carefully replaces the access panel. Then he makes his way across the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis stops. Ahead of him is a revolving TV camera. Challis presses himself into the shadows, moving off in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 272
dialogues.text: He scampers across the roof, ducking down to avoid the view of another remote camera. Finally he makes it over to the edge. He flattens himself on the eave and lowers himself over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cochran and the technician are standing over a console.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Still blank. Suddenly the image reappears: A GUARD rips the mask off the lens. We see the overturned chair. The shattered TV set. The ventilator panel on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: We've lost him--

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Not yet. Cochran moves over to another console.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: From the ceiling: a view of Ellie tied to her chair. In front of a TV set. Then we see the door open. And then we see Challis dash in and start untying Ellie!

dialogues.speaker: ON. COCHRAN
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: South corridor. The room springs to life. GUARDS run for exits. TECHNICIANS move to their consoles. 92. 273 274 275 276 277  93.

dialogues.speaker: J 278 INT. SMALL ROOM
dialogues.text: Challis unties Ellie. They dash out the door. CAMERA MOVES IN on the wall clock. 8:26!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race down a corridor. Full speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Challis and Ellie burst through a door. Start to move forward down the corridor. Then stop.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: At the other end of the second corridor. FACTORY GUARDS race toward them!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS AND ELLIE 282
dialogues.text: They turn down another hallway. CAMERA PANAGLIDES AFTER THEM as they run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA HURTLES ALONG with Challis and Ellie. Through a dark warehouse area. Past stacks of packing crates. . Machines. Weaving through crates and’ boxes. Challis stops short. Pulls Ellie down behind a large crate. Just missing the view of a revolving TV camera in the ceiling. There are large TV monitors in every corner of the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Factory guards pour into the warehouse area. At one end of the room is a large glass control booth. This is the high-tech area. Stairs lead up to a door in the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass window looks down into the warehouse area. Cochran watches the guards searching around. Then he moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cochran emerges from the high tech area and starts down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND CRATE
dialogues.text: Hiding. As the guards search. oy Challis softly grabs a large box lying nearby. He SS carefully pulls open the top.

dialogues.speaker: BOX
dialogues.text: The box is filled with the tiny trefoil logos!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS AND ELLIE 289
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ON COCHRAN AND GUARDS
dialogues.text: Cochran and the guards move slowly past the machines and crates. Boxes are overturned. Cochran stops in the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards fan out. Cochran remains in the middle. We catch a glimpse of Challis and Ellie moving up the stairs to the high-tech area behind them!  292 293 294 295 296 297 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis and Ellie dart into the high-tech area. Before any of the technicians can react, Challis races to a console.

dialogues.speaker: CONSOLE
dialogues.text: Challis' hand punches several buttons. Trying to find the right one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the large TV monitors in the corner flash to life! On each of them: the last TV commercial! Cochran spins around. Looks up toward the high-tech area.

dialogues.speaker: GLASS BOOTH AND CATWALK
dialogues.text: Challis and Ellie race out of the high-tech area across a catwalk above Cochran and the guards.

dialogues.speaker: COCHRAN
dialogues.text: Stop them! Suddenly the flashing strobe light begins on the monitors! CAMERA PUSHES IN. to Cochran's face! CocHRAN (continuing) Stop them!

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS AND ELLIE ON CATWALK
dialogues.text: Challis thrusts his hands into the box, grabbing handfuls of logos! He hurls them down! 292 293 294 295 296 297

dialogues.speaker: TV MONITOR 298
dialogues.text: The logos hit the flickering screen! A spark ZIPS, firing a micro-chip! Then another ZIP! And another!

dialogues.speaker: FACTORY GUARD 299
dialogues.text: A FACTORY GUARD is hit with a micro-chip! He instantly short-circuits! Silicone slime sprays out of his mouth! His body locks into a rigid position and falls to the floor!

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS 300
dialogues.text: Challis holds up the box and dumps it over the edge of the catwalk!

dialogues.speaker: ON LOGOS 301
dialogues.text: The tiny logos tumble downward, raining, turning!

dialogues.speaker: ON TV MONITOR 302
dialogues.text: The logos pass the screen. The sparks are ZIPPING everywhere!

dialogues.speaker: ON COCHRAN AND GUARDS 303
dialogues.text: The micro-chips find their targets! GUARDS shudder and go rigid all around as the sparks flash into them! They tumble to the floor! Cochran stands for a moment, looking up at Challis. He seems almost impressed by the turn of the tables. .Something .close to a smile.crosses his lips. And then he is covered with sparks! As if a swarm of fiery hornets. have covered him!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS AND ELLIE ON CATWALK 304
dialogues.text: The flashing and sparking from below illuminate Challis and Ellie running away down the catwalk!  305 306 307 308 309

Cochran undergoes the most appalling change. He seems to be swelling to a monstrous size, towering above the fallen guards around him. His head is bulgin ushing outward into some strange shape! It continues to swell, melting, changing, into the shape of a grotesque pumpkin! Then Cochran collapses, a twitching heap on the floor! Dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole warehouse area is exploding. Sparks catching on the packing insulation. There are flames now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames lick in the windows of the factory. Somewhere we hear a DULL EXPLOSION. Challis and Ellie race across the factory yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie's car ROARS along the lonely road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis drives like a madman... Ellie is

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: next to him in the ‘passenger. seat... Challis. turns on the’ radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +.-expecting overcast skies and a 50 percent chance of rain through Monday. It's presently 74 degrees at 8:48 p.m. Challis pushes down on the accelerator. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Gotta make it to that gas station! Another five or six miles... The Silver Shamrock commercial comes over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN, TV SCREEN...
dialogues.text: Challis CLICKS off the radio. He glances over at Ellie. She sits quietly in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Ellie, you all right...? Suddenly Ellie turns to Challis. A cold, blank expression on her face. There is just a beat. And_then she lunges for him! Her hand SNAPS across his face like a steel vice! Her other hand grabs the wheel of the car!

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (a shriek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car swerves wildly along the road!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis and Ellie battle viciously. He tries to push her away but her strength is too much. She claws at his face. Leaving tracks of bloodied flesh. Challis SLAMS at her face with his fist! The blows register no impact! Her face is calm, emotionless! 98.

dialogues.speaker: STEERING WHEEL . 312
dialogues.text: Ellie's hand yanks the wheel hard to the right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car heads right for a tree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front end buckled-in like a child's toy, the car THUMPS down to the ground from the impact! Challis tumbles out of the car, rolling across the ground. He shakily scrambles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ON ELLIE 315
dialogues.text: Ellie emerges from the other side. Stands up. And we see that one of her arms is missing! But still the calm, even expression on her face!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 316
dialogues.text: His face frozen with horror! He runs to the rear of the car! The trunk has sprung open. Challis reaches inside and grabs a tire iron. But suddenly, from around the side of the car, Ellie is_on him again, her single arm SNAPPING OUT and locking on his face! Challis raises the tire iron! And. SLAMS”it home! Right across Ellie's FACE! With a WHAP!

dialogues.speaker: ON ELLIE 317
dialogues.text: She staggers back stiffly. Silicone spewing from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 318
dialogues.text: Moves forward. Raises the tire iron again. Swings.

dialogues.speaker: ON ELLIE 319
dialogues.text: WHANG! Ellie spins around, her head cocked at an impossible angle! Then she falls face forward to the ground!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 320
dialogues.text: He stares down at her.

dialogues.speaker: ON ELLIE- 321
dialogues.text: Motionless. Eyes open. From the torn joint of her severed arm pours silicone. And we can see elec- tronics slowing, spinning to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 322
dialogues.text: Challis slowly moves back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides in. Puts the car in reverse. Tries to back it off the tree. But the car only GRINDS and rocks back and forth. Challis starts to slide back out. When Ellie's severed arm leaps up from the floor!

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS 324
dialogues.text: The fingers cla around his face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis tumbles back out! The arm stuck fast to his head! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He rolls on the ground! Finally pulls the fingers off! And hurls the arm away from him! Then Challis scrambles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ELLIE'S ARM
dialogues.text: The severed arm lies on the ground. The fingers still moving, clawing!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS
dialogues.text: He turns away from the horror and races off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Challis, filthy and ragged, races up to the gas station. He halts wearily at the sight of a MAN emerging from the lighted booth. But as Jones comes nearer Challis rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: Gotta--use your phone! It's-- life and death--

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Sure, man...don't I know you? Challis goes tottering into the gas station, followed by Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is minutes later. Challis is telephoning and keeping his eyes on the small, battered TV set. It is showing the last commercial. The sound is off.

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: {into phone; tormented) ...If it goes out it means the death of millions of people! Everyone watching! Do you under--then say it's a bomb! (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (continuing; into phone; nearly weeping) No, I can't prove...! You've got to believe me! Challis glances around for an instant.

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION 330
dialogues.text: Jones is in the doorway, watching him quizzically. And there are CHILDREN, a couple of them, standing behind Jones dressed in Halloween costumes. Each wears a Silver Shamrock mask! The TV screen flickers. The commercial vanishes abruptly! Followed by a station signal: "We Apologize For This Interruption..."

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 331
dialogues.text: Relieved! He reaches to the TV set and CLICKS the channel changer.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV . 332
dialogues.text: The commercial! But _a second later it too is cut off! A card reads: "Stand By." Challis flips to another channel. The commercial is still there! Dancing JACK-O-LANTERN heads!

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (into phone, frantically) The third channel...Get it off the air--get it off! Get it...!

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN 334
dialogues.text: In the doorway the CHILDREN watch. Now they move closer toward the TV set! All of them wearing their Silver Shamrock masks!

dialogues.speaker: ON CHALLIS 335
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES IN on Challis as he watches in horror. Then the flashing, flickering starts from the TV, off-screen. The strobing light plays across his face. Glittering in his wild, terrified eyes!

dialogues.speaker: CHALLIS
dialogues.text: (into phone, screaming) Turn it off! For God's sake, turn it off now! Stop it! (to attendant) Turn it off! Stop it! (to CAMERA) Stop it!
